page.title: 01Gaddesden Row Survey Block
page.content: -Gaddesden Row is an{ancient roadway, not a village. Its centre is Gaddesden Row Primary schooL opened in 1877. The area is in{Great Gaddesden Parish, which is in two parts on either side of the{River Gade.}The survey block is rural and contains most of the Halsey estate. -The surveying schools are Holtsmere End Junior School and Gaddesden Row C.P. Pupils come from, respectively, Hemel Hempstead and Jockey's End. -There is not much private property in the survey block and it is very expensive. There are many beautiful farm fields surrounded by woodland. Wildlife is plentiful. Narrow lanes with passing places cut through the fields. It is a very good place to walk and is especially good for horse riding. -There are many good riding schools.
